dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2731 IH: Stop Taxpayer-Funded Alcohol Marketing Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Russell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Agricultural Risk Protection Act of 2000 to eliminate the authority of the Secretary of Agriculture to make value-added agricultural product market development grants to support the development, production, or marketing of alcoholic beverages and to rescind a portion of the Commodity Credit Corporation funds made available for such grants.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Taxpayer-Funded Alcohol Marketing Act.

section.header: Value-added agricultural product market development grants

subsection.header: Exclusion of alcohol products from definition
subsection.text: Section 231(a)(5) of the Agricultural Risk Protection Act of 2000 (7 U.S.C. 1632a(a)(5)) is amended by adding below subparagraph (B) the following:

quoted-block.quoted-block-continuation-text: The term value-added agricultural product does not include beer, wine, distilled spirits, hard cider, or other alcohol product.

subsection.text: Of the funds made available under section 231(b)(7)(A) of the Agricultural Risk Protection Act of 2000 (7 U.S.C. 1632a(b)(7)(A)) to the Secretary of Agriculture to make value-added agricultural product market development grants and unobligated as of the date of the enactment of this Act, $8,000,000 is hereby rescinded.
